column5: Obama! lol   As for the kids and the dogs in the water... I like to think they are just scaring the fish closer to my bait lol.

bugs and lightning..  D'OH!!
laziness and procrastination, stay away from it and life is gooooooood

The woman that was throwing a stick to her dog about 20 feet from us in our boat this past weeekend. I think she was doing it on purpose because we were fishing out front of her cottage. Oh well she learned her lesson. We decided to switch over to practising for duck season, and pulled out a box of clays and the 12 guages.  JK of course, but the thought did cross minds.
An accurate credit rating!
huge , check that license!
What a stupid post...only a disgrunteled insensitive selfserving moron would have issues with kids and dogs......lighten up or go fish elsewhere!!!!!
ITT: A person without any attention span unable to read the whole post.

I read the whole post and basically what you are saying is that as long as they are doing what you think they should be doing and not annoying you, then they are ok.....if not then they are stupid.  I repeat what I said in my first post!!
You did read it wrong Musky. There is no need to be calling people a moron or any other names either.  YES! WORK! The biggest enemy by far...followed by a lack of money.

No but you Rhomosaurus Now have A Friend  My life was peaceful ..........................till you started it  Its not fish heads you should eat but fish brains hahahahahahaha  Matt "This only applies to ignorant owners/parents, I've come across awesome dogs and calm children" Not everyone teach respect of others and thats what he was saying Consideration for others goes a long way
peaceful? you must mean boring.. ?  We are all a form of prehistoric animal or another.. Rhomosaurus, snorpehasorus, fatassorus, etc!  mmmmmm fish brains!
Garbage left on shore.

Ron, your like a jilted Rice lake lover.   Biggest enemy....cash$$$. With enough cash you could just buy the whole lake and if that lake was Scugog you could drain the thing and start farming there again.
The internet way to many people on her trolling and not helping others out finding spots just taking them from the net and over fishing them. Posting pics with way to many details.

Growing up and becoming a family man.  It's simply my little girls, can't help but want to spent as much time as I can with them, even if it's just watching Max and Ruby or catching crappie.  Can't wait til they get aliitle older though to really show them the angling ropes!

BUGS and more BUgs , nothing worse that BLACK FLIES , skiders i can stand (lots of deet) but those little black buggers are hell on earth ... probably the only thing ever comes between me and fishing ..rain wind etc. I will find a way around (even angry wife)but something so tiny yet so bothersome .. BLACK FLIES
I'm gonna go with time and money!  I can deal with bugs, wind and rain but there aren't enough hours in my day or dollars in my account!

It sounds like your frustration comes from fishing in a park. But that kind of a place is for everybody, so you need to get further afield.  Besides, if it's easy to get at it's probably fished too much anyway. Look for spots where you have to work to get at the water. Then you'll be fishing less-fished waters, and the dogs and kiddies will leave you alone.

Yep, the problem is I don't have my G license, or a car. For now I generally fish at a local pond, it's nice but annoying when a random kids runs out of no where and throws a rock where you're fishing at. Luckily in the summer we spend a lot of time at Provincial Parks, and many of the areas don't have many people, plus we own a boat.

IMO it's either dogs or kids. Stupid dogs be swimming in the waters I be fishin'. Or stupid kids be throwin' rocks because "hurr it splashes." I mean if you're going to be taking your children out for a stroll by the local pond, atleast teach them some basic respect for the people around them (or keep a close eye on them). Kids + dogs = unfishable waters. This only applies to ignorant owners/parents, I've come across awesome dogs and calm children.
I believe the fishermans worst enemy is:                                                                   WIND!!!!
worse enemy - time! Between work, wife, kids, in-laws, community involvement etc I've got minimal time to go the local pond to be annoyed by the dogs/kids there!
birds
Small fish
I vote for white buckets!
I agree with responsibilities being a fishermans worst enemy (mostly work lol)
Agreed, that darn work thing always gets in the way
Fisherman's worst enemy?  Rice Lake Tourists Association.
Lightning.
Wind,   followed closely by my wife. Man I hope she doesn't read this.
myself and my poor fishing skills  :D
Bank manager

Nah Mykester, You can't blame anyone or anything, especially when they're all naive and not aware. I bet you've thrown rocks into the water plenty of times when you were young. Sure is a lot of fun when the fish were slowing down!  I say the worst enemy is a thunderstorm though..you can't even get on the water with that. All the other times, don't blame the fish, blame the yourself for not finding them

A negative attitude imo is a fisherman worst enemy. I cringe when I fish with someone who constantly whines," There's no fish here" and halfheartedly casts expecting no bites and then gets a knot in his line and concludes that everything is working against him. oh boy what a downer.  Never seen a good fisherman with a negative attitude. I learned to always cast like you are expecting a bite and to be ready and alert for a bite. Positive attitude is key.

while it might be frustrating to have rock or dog activity close to where you are fishing, all things said, they have as much a right to use the water for their personal uses as you do.  by the same token, a person throwing sticks to their dog could state that your casting of lures makes it unsafe for their dog to swim.  we are all stakeholders and need to learn to live with each other (except for sea doo'ers, those guys are just plain arseholes).
btw, the #1 enemy to fishing is DEFINITELY work. (the honey-do list is a close second)
A noisy truck muffler that wakes the wife when yur tip toe'n ot the door at 5'ish
I've met the enemy....it's me.
Buy him a beer Roy--maybe ya can work it out with him
I say a fisherman's worst enemy is having the skitters....trotts...runs...poops....yeah, no bathrooms out in the bush hahaha
Lightning then wind then wif... caught myself.
You have been hanging around the scotish Rhomo too much. :-)
